greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Riordan array (1/sqrt(1-2*x-3*x^2), ((1-2*x-3*x^2)/(2*(1-3*x)) - sqrt(1-2*x-3*x^2)/2).
comment: First column is central trinomial coefficients A002426. Second column is number of directed animals of size n+1, A005773(n+1). Row sums are A005717 (number of horizontal steps in all Motzkin paths of length n). First column has e.g.f. exp(x) I_0(2x). Row sums have e.g.f. dif(exp(x) I_1(2x),x).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 100 rows, flattened
mathematica: Table[Sum[ Binomial[n-k, j-k]*Binomial[j, n-j], {j, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n} ] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 07 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = sum(j=0, n, binomial(n-k, j-k)*binomial(j, n-j))}; \\ _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019
(MAGMA) [[(&+[Binomial(n-k, j-k)*Binomial(j, n-j): j in [0..n]]): k in [0..n]]: n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019
(Sage) [[sum(binomial(n-k, j-k)*binomial(j, n-j) for j in (0..n)) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019
(GAP) Flat(List([0..10], n-> List([0..n], k-> Sum([0..n], j-> Binomial(n-k, j-k)*Binomial(j, n-j)) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Feb 10 2006
